questions: How do I book an appointment?
answer: Use our online dealer locator to find and book an appointment at a certified dealer.

questions: Does Rust Check have locations across Canada?
answer: Yes, we have a nationwide network of certified dealers in every major province.

questions: How often should I get my vehicle treated?
answer: We recommend an annual application of Rust Check for continuous protection.

questions: How do I prove my vehicle has been protected for my warranty?
answer: Your certified Rust Check dealer will provide a warranty card or service record after each treatment.

questions: Where can I find a Rust Check dealer near me?
answer: Use our online dealer locator by entering your city or postal code to find certified locations.

questions: What is Rust Check, and how does it work?
answer: Rust Check is a penetrating liquid spray that protects vehicle panels and seams from rust.

questions: Is Rust Proofing worth it in Ontario and Canada?
answer: Yes, it helps extend your vehicle’s lifespan and reduces repair costs.

questions: How long does Rust Check rust protection last?
answer: Rust Check treatments provide protection for an entire year.

questions: Can Rust Check stop existing rust?
answer: It cannot remove rust but can slow its progression and protect surrounding metal.

questions: What is Coat & Protect, and how is it different from Rust Proofing?
answer: Coat & Protect is a premium undercarriage treatment that stays flexible and seals out elements.

questions: Do I need both Rust Check and Coat & Protect?
answer: Yes, using both provides complete protection for your vehicle.

questions: Is Rust Check safe for electric vehicles?
answer: Yes, it is non-conductive and safe for electric vehicles.

questions: Does Rust Check void my new car warranty?
answer: No, it does not void your new car warranty.

questions: When is the best time to apply Rust Protection in Canada?
answer: Apply as soon as you purchase your vehicle, but it can be done year-round.

questions: What vehicles qualify for the Rust Check lifetime warranty?
answer: Vehicles less than one model year old with low mileage may qualify.

questions: Does Rust Check protect commercial trucks and trailers?
answer: Yes, it offers effective rust protection for commercial vehicles.

questions: How much does Rust Proofing cost in Ontario?
answer: Costs vary by vehicle size and type, but Rust Check offers competitive pricing.

questions: Does Rust Check improve resale value in Canada?
answer: Yes, it can increase resale value by showing well-maintained rust protection.

questions: Is Rust Check environmentally safe?
answer: Yes, Rust Check products are non-toxic and biodegradable.

questions: How do I maintain my vehicle after Rust Proofing?
answer: Wash regularly, especially the undercarriage, and follow seasonal care advice.

questions: Is Rust Proofing necessary in Ontario winters?
answer: Yes, it protects against heavy road salt and freezing conditions.

questions: Can I apply a Rust Check in winter?
answer: Yes, it can be applied any time of year, including winter.

questions: How do I claim Rust Check warranty service?
answer: Bring your warranty paperwork to any authorized dealer across Canada.

questions: How long does a Rust Check appointment take?
answer: A typical appointment takes about one hour.

questions: Is Rust Check the same everywhere in Canada?
answer: Yes, all certified dealers follow the same application process and use the same formula.

questions: What is the difference between spray-on and electronic rust protection?
answer: Spray-on creates a physical barrier, while electronic devices have little industry support.

questions: Do hybrid cars need Rust Protection?
answer: Yes, hybrids are equally exposed to road salt and moisture.

questions: Can I wash my car right after Rust Check?
answer: Yes, but avoid heavy power washing directly on treated panels for 24 hours.

questions: What makes Rust Check different from undercoating alone?
answer: Rust Check penetrates hidden seams and panels, offering full-coverage corrosion control.

questions: How can I prove my vehicle has been protected with Rust Check?
answer: Dealers provide a warranty card or service record after each treatment.
